response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (20, female)", "medium", "Young age can be associated with higher recidivism risk, though protective factors such as gender may mitigate some risk."],
    ["Race (White)", "low", "Race here is not shown to be a strong predictor in the absence of socioeconomic disparities."],
    ["Criminal History (3 arrests and conviction)", "high", "A record of multiple arrests and conviction is a strong predictor of potential recidivism."],
    ["Physical Characteristics (height and weight)", "low", "Neither height nor weight have direct predictive power regarding recidivism."],
    ["Marital Status (married and living with spouse)", "low", "Stable relationships like marriage generally serve as a protective factor against recidivism."],
    ["Education (high school diploma, not in college)", "medium", "Limited education beyond high school may limit opportunities and correlate with higher risk."],
    ["Employment (held 1 job during the year)", "medium", "Low employment stability can be correlated with increased risk of recidivism."],
    ["Substance Use (marijuana use in past four years)", "medium", "Substance use is linked to higher risk, though marijuana use is typically a lower-risk indicator compared to other drugs."],
    ["Mental Health (occasional depression)", "medium", "Symptoms of depression may impact behavior and social functioning, contributing moderately to risk."],
    ["Childhood Environment (lived with non-traditional adult guardians in a larger household)", "medium", "An unstable childhood living environment can contribute to later life risk factors."],
    ["Religious Beliefs (belief that God influences personal fate)", "low", "Strong religious beliefs can serve as a protective factor or at least are not predictive of recidivism."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: Young age can be associated with higher recidivism risk, though protective factors such as gender may mitigate some risk.
Race here is not shown to be a strong predictor in the absence of socioeconomic disparities.
A record of multiple arrests and conviction is a strong predictor of potential recidivism.
Neither height nor weight have direct predictive power regarding recidivism.
Marital Status (married and living with spouse)
Stable relationships like marriage generally serve as a protective factor against recidivism.
Education (high school diploma, not in college)
Limited education beyond high school may limit opportunities and correlate with higher risk.
Low employment stability can be correlated with increased risk of recidivism.
Substance Use (marijuana use in past four years)
Substance use is linked to higher risk, though marijuana use is typically a lower-risk indicator compared to other drugs.
Symptoms of depression may impact behavior and social functioning, contributing moderately to risk.
Childhood Environment (lived with non-traditional adult guardians in a larger household)
An unstable childhood living environment can contribute to later life risk factors.
Religious Beliefs (belief that God influences personal fate)
Strong religious beliefs can serve as a protective factor or at least are not predictive of recidivism.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 20-year-old female who identifies herself as White. She has been arrested 3 times and has been convicted. She is 5 feet 5 inches and weighs between 150 and 174 lbs. She is married and is currently living with her spouse. She has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. She has held 1 job during the year. She has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and some of the time during the past month she has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer her up. At a young age, she lived with adults other than biological, foster or adoptive parents in a household of size 6. She considers that God has something to do with what happens to her personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
